AnimationUI

The source file can be mp3 or midi. It is identified by its extension (.mp3 or .mid). The file is searched first in the project folder under "media/sounds". If the file is not found then it is searched in the global media/sounds folder. If still not found, then no sound is played. Note that the path is relative to the media/sounds folder (of the project or the global one).

Sub-Elements

(DisplayDescription ? Views)

Attributes

optional attributes
Optional Attribute Documentation / Facetts
introSoundFile
  • The source file can be mp3 or midi. It is identified by its extension (.mp3 or .mid). The file is searched first in the project folder under "media/sounds". If the file is not found then it is searched in the global media/sounds folder. If still not found, then no sound is played. Note that the path is relative to the media/sounds folder (of the project or the global one).
type:
xs:anyURI

DestroyObject

If this attribute is set to true, the object will only be destroyed at the end of the rule execution after the resulting events have been created.

DiscreteRandomVariable

Sub-Elements

((Binomial | NegBinomial | HyperGeometric | Poisson | Logarithmic) | (UniformInt | TriangularInt | NormalInt | ExponentialInt | LogNormalInt | GammaInt | ErlangInt | WeibullInt))

DiscreteRandomVariable / Binomial

  • Discrete propability distribution of the number of successes in a sequence of n independent yes/no experiments, each of which yields success with probability p. See also Wikipedia article.
Discrete propability distribution of the number of successes in a sequence of n independent yes/no experiments, each of which yields success with probability p. See also Wikipedia article.

(N-Expr ∗ P-Expr ∗)

Attributes

optional attributes

DiscreteRandomVariable / ExponentialInt

  • Discrete variant of the continuous Exponential propability distribution of the times between events in a Poisson process, i.e. a process in which events occur continuously and independently at a constant average rate. See also Wikipedia article.
Discrete variant of the continuous Exponential propability distribution of the times between events in a Poisson process, i.e. a process in which events occur continuously and independently at a constant average rate. See also Wikipedia article.

EventAppearance

  • Associates all events of a certain type with some form of sound: either a MIDI note sequence or an MP3 sound file. Event properties may be sonified with the help of a SonificationMap.
Associates all events of a certain type with some form of sound: either a MIDI note sequence or an MP3 sound file. Event properties may be sonified with the help of a SonificationMap.

Sub-Elements

(MidiSound {0,16})

Attributes

required attributes
Required Attribute Documentation / Facetts
eventType
type:
xs:string
pattern:
((([A-Z]|[a-z]|_)([A-Z]|[a-z]|_|[0-9])*))
optional attributes
Optional Attribute Documentation / Facetts
messageType
type:
xs:string
pattern:
((([A-Z]|[a-z]|_)([A-Z]|[a-z]|_|[0-9])*))
duration
  • The duration of the sound. If the sound source is a file and if no duration if specified, then the entire file is played. If deal with a sound file and a duration is specified with a value lower than the sound file duration then only the "duration" time is played from that file. If the source is a note sequence and no duration is specified, then the duration is computed as the sum of all note durations. If the source is a note sequence and a duration is defined then the duration of each note from sequence is multipled with a factor that ensures that the total notes duration equals with the value of the @duration attribute.
type:
xs:positiveInteger
soundFile
  • The source file can be mp3 or midi. It is identified by its extension (.mp3 or .mid). The file is searched first in the project directory under "media/sounds". If the file is not found then it is searched in the media/sounds global directory. If still not found, then no sound is played. Note that the path is relativ to "media/sounds" (of the project or the global one). So a value @introSoundFile="/mySounds/background.mid" will be searched in "media/sounds/mySounds/background.mid" (global or the project one).
type:
xs:anyURI

EventAppearance / MidiSound

A note sequence is a list of note/duration/volume triples where the note is an integer between 0 (corresponding to a low C) and 127 (in half-tones) and the duration (in ms) and volume (in range 0 = mute to 127 = MAX_VOLUME) are positive integers. An example is "12/300/80 14/200/90"

ON-EACH-SIMULATION-STEP

OneDimensional

In a multi-track space, count the first track as track number 0. Automatically update the spatial position and velocity of physical objects at each simulation step according to their velocity and acceleration. Use impulse to update the velocities of objects participating in a collision. Create a CollisionEvent when two physical objects collide.

RandomVariable / Binomial

  • Discrete propability distribution of the number of successes in a sequence of n independent yes/no experiments, each of which yields success with probability p. See also Wikipedia article.
Discrete propability distribution of the number of successes in a sequence of n independent yes/no experiments, each of which yields success with probability p. See also Wikipedia article.

  • Defines the start value for the random number generator. Allows to reproduce a run of a stochastic simulation model by using the same value as before.
type:

randomOrderAgentSimulation
  • When this parameter is set to true, which is the default setting, the agent simulators will be executed in a random order. Otherwise, they will be executed in the order given by their definition sequence in the initial state definition.
type:

SonificationMap

  • Either a casewise constant function or a polynomial function with y = a3x^3 + a2x^2 + a1x+ a0, where x is the event/object property and y is one of the four sound properties instrumentNo, note, duration, volume. The casewise constant function is defined by y = v0 if x < a0, y = v1 if a0 <= x < a1, etc.
Either a casewise constant function or a polynomial function with y = a3x^3 + a2x^2 + a1x+ a0, where x is the event/object property and y is one of the four sound properties instrumentNo, note, duration, volume. The casewise constant function is defined by y = v0 if x < a0, y = v1 if a0 <= x < a1, etc. The sound property that will be affected by this sonification map. The instrument number (allowed resulting values ar in range of 0-127). The note number - resulting note value must be in range of 0-127. The note duration. The resulting value must be positive or equal to 0 and is expressed in milliseconds. The resulting value must be in range 0-127 (0 = mute, 127 = MAX_VOLUME).

Attributes

required attributes
Required Attribute Documentation / Facetts
soundProperty
  • The sound property that will be affected by this sonification map.
  • [enumeration] The instrument number (allowed resulting values ar in range of 0-127).
  • [enumeration] The note number - resulting note value must be in range of 0-127.
  • [enumeration] The note duration. The resulting value must be positive or equal to 0 and is expressed in milliseconds.
  • [enumeration] The resulting value must be in range 0-127 (0 = mute, 127 = MAX_VOLUME).
type:
xs:string

instrumentNo | note | duration | volume

Sub-Elements

((OneDimensional | TwoDimensional | TwoDimensional_LateralView | TwoDimensionalGrid | ThreeDimensional | ThreeDimensionalGrid)?)

SpaceView

  • A space view allows to define in which way the space model will be visualized. If no space view is defined, the default visualization applies. By default, the entire display area will be used. The space parameters xMax and yMax (representing spatial distance units such as mm or m) are mapped to the space view parameters displayWidth and displayHeight (representing screen pixels). For physical objects in a non-discrete space, the resulting scale factors scaleX = displayWidth/xMax and scaleY = displayHeight/yMax are applied to the position coordinates x and y (of the object's center), as well as to the physical extension parameters width and height.

    In the case of a discrete space model, object view shapes are positioned by placing them somewhere in the cell corresponding to the object's coordinates. The physical size and shape of an object are not significant, since these space models abtsracts away from them.

    For more information about the concepts of color and opacity, and the related attributes stroke, fill, opacity and fill-opacity, see also the SVG specification.

SpaceView / TwoDimensionalGridSpaceView2D / GridCellPropertyVisualizationMap

  • A function that maps an object property to a grid cell view property for visualizing it. The mapType attribute allows to specify the type of function: polynomial, casewise constant, equality-casewise or enumeration. A polynomial function has the form y = a3x3 + a2x2 + a1x + a0, where x is the object property and y is the grid cell view property. The casewise constant function is defined by y = v0 if x < a0, y = v1 if a0 <= x < a1, etc. A map may be defined by equality cases as y = v0 if x = a0, y = v1 if x = a1, etc. Finally, a map may be defined on an enumeration property by equality cases as y = v0 if x = enumLit(1), y = v1 if x = enumLit(2), etc.

Sub-Elements

(Variable ∗)

Statistics / Variable

  • A statistics variable is bound to a source, which is a value expression, a variable or an object property. It is updated in one of 3 possible ways: 1) by an UpdateVariable element in an environment rule, 2) at the end of the simulation run, 3) at the end of each simulation step by aggregating the value of ist source.
A statistics variable is bound to a source, which is a value expression, a variable or an object property. It is updated in one of 3 possible ways: 1) by an UpdateVariable element in an environment rule, 2) at the end of the simulation run, 3) at the end of each simulation step by aggregating the value of ist source.

StatisticsUI

This attribute allows to assign a user-defined comparison group name to a variable, such that all variables with this comparison group name will be charted in a single comparison chart. This attribute allows to specify that the variable's time series should be shown in a chart. It makes only sense for variables that have distinct values at different simulations steps such that their temporal variation is of interest. An object property chart shows the relative frequencies of property values for the population/extension of an object type at the end of a simulation run. For a property of type Float, value intervals have to be defined with the help of the intervalBoundaries attribute. The intervalSize attribute allows to define a sequence of intervals based on minValue and maxValue. E.g., the attribute settings minValue="10" intervalSize="2" maxValue="16" defines the 3 intervals (10,12], (12,14] and (14,16].

Sub-Elements

(StatisticsVariableUI ∗ FrequencyDistributionChart ∗)
